info.title: Order Management
info.description: The Walmart Order Management APIs help Drop Ship Vendors stay up to date on order fulfillment.

post.description:
Allows consumers to ship one or more Purchase Order lines. For Site to Store (S2S) orders, Package ASN and Pallet ASN need to be included in the request payload.

Changing the status of order lines to "Shipped" triggers the charge to the customer. In order to avoid underselling, orders must be acknowledged before sending a shipping update. Once an order line is marked as shipped, it cannot be updated.

**Note: shipDateTime must be in UTC. **

The response to a successful call contains the order with the shipped line item.

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: A unique ID associated with the purchase order, used for querying

parameters.name: shipNode
parameters.description: The Distribution Facility “Distributor ID” which uniquely identifies each facility and is autogenerated during DSV account creation. Every time you add/update a facility in the Supplier Center, a new ID is generated

post.description:
Cancels one or more order lines before an order has been fulfilled. A purchaseOrderId must be included to cancel an order line. After cancelling an order, the inventory for the cancelled order should be updated.

The response to a successful call contains the order with the cancelled line item.

Cancellation Reasons supported:
SUPPLIER_CANCEL_CUSTOMER_REQUEST
SUPPLIER_CANCEL_BACKORDER
SUPPLIER_CANCEL_DISCONTINUE
SUPPLIER_CANCEL_UNRECOGNIZED

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: A unique ID associated with the purchase order. Used for querying.

parameters.name: shipNode
parameters.description: The Distribution Facility “Distributor ID” which uniquely identifies each facility and is autogenerated during DSV account creation. Every time you add/update a facility in the Supplier Center, a new ID is generated

post.description:
Allows a DSV to acknowledge an order, including all order lines, preferably within four hours of receipt of the order.

The response to a successful call contains the acknowledged order. As a good practice, acknowledge your orders to avoid underselling.

Only those orders that are in a Created state should be acknowledged.
Orders that are in an Acknowledged state can be re-acknowledged. This is desirable, for example, when resolving an error response from a previous API call. Orders with line items that are shipped or cancelled should not be re-acknowledged.

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: A unique ID associated with the purchase order. Used for querying an order.

parameters.name: shipNode
parameters.description: The Distribution Facility “Distributor ID” which uniquely identifies each facility and is autogenerated during DSV account creation. Every time you add/update a facility in the Supplier Center, a new ID is generated

get.description:
Retrieves the details of all the orders for specified search criteria.

Only orders created in last 180 days and a maximum of 20000 orders can be fetched at a time. Attempting to download more than 20000 orders will return an error.

parameters.name: shipNode
parameters.description: The Distribution Facility “Distributor ID” which uniquely identifies each facility and is autogenerated during DSV account creation. Every time you add/update a facility in the Supplier Center, a new ID is generated

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of orders to be returned. Cannot be larger than 200.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the DSV, which identifies each item. This will be used by the DSV in the XSD file to refer to each item. Special characters in the sku needing encoding are: ':', '/', '?', '#', '[', ']', '@', '!', '$', '&', "'", '(', ')', '*', '+', ',', ';', '=', as well as '%' itself. Other characters don't need to be encoded.

parameters.name: customerOrderId
parameters.description: A unique ID associated with the sales orders to retrieve or filter the orders

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: A unique ID associated with the purchase order. Used to query a purchase order.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of purchase order line. Valid statuses are: Created, Acknowledged, Shipped, Delivered and Cancelled.

parameters.name: createdStartDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that were created after this date. Default is current date - 7 days Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ).

parameters.name: createdEndDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that were created before this date. Default is current date. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ).

parameters.name: fromExpectedShipDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that have order lines with an expected ship date after this date. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ)

parameters.name: toExpectedShipDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that have order lines with an expected ship date before this date. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ)

parameters.name: productInfo
parameters.description: Provides the image URL and product weight in response, if available. Allowed values are true or false.

get.description:
Retrieves an order detail for a specific purchaseOrderId and shipNode.

Only orders created in last 180 days can be fetched.

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: A unique ID associated with the purchase order, used for querying an order

parameters.name: shipNode
parameters.description: The Distribution Facility “Distributor ID” which uniquely identifies each facility and is autogenerated during DSV account creation. Every time you add/update a facility in the Supplier Center, a new ID is generated

parameters.name: productInfo
parameters.description: Provides the image URL and product weight in response, if available. Allowed values are true or false.

get.description:
Retrieves all the orders with line items that are in the "created" status, that is, these orders have been released from the Walmart Order Management System to the seller for processing. The released orders are the orders that are ready for a seller to fulfill.

Only orders created in last 180 days and a maximum of 20000 orders can be fetched at a time. Attempting to download more than 20000 orders will return an error.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the DSV, which identifies each item. This will be used by the DSV in the XSD file to refer to each item. Special characters in the sku needing encoding are: ':', '/', '?', '#', '[', ']', '@', '!', '$', '&', "'", '(', ')', '*', '+', ',', ';', '=', as well as '%' itself. Other characters don't need to be encoded.

parameters.name: customerOrderId
parameters.description: A unique ID associated with the sales orders to retrieve or filter the orders

parameters.name: fromExpectedShipDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that have order lines with an expected ship date after this date. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ)

parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that have order lines with an expected ship date before this date. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ)

parameters.name: shipNode
parameters.description: The Distribution Facility “Distributor ID” which uniquely identifies each facility and is autogenerated during DSV account creation. Every time you add/update a facility in the Supplier Center, a new ID is generated

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of orders to be returned. Cannot be larger than 200.

parameters.name: productInfo
parameters.description: Provides the image URL and product weight in response, if available. Allowed values are true or false.

otherCarrier.description: Other carrier name, When otherCarrier is used, trackingUrl must also be provided

carrier.description: The package shipment carrier. Valid entries are: UPS, USPS, FedEx, Airborne, OnTrac, DHL, LS (LaserShip), UDS (United Delivery Service), UPSMI (UPS Mail Innovations), FDX, FEDEXSP (FedEx SmartPost).

chargeType.description: The charge type for line items can be one of the following: PRODUCT or SHIPPING For details, refer to 'Charge Types'

chargeName.description: If chargeType is PRODUCT, chargeName is Item Price. If chargeType is SHIPPING, chargeName is Shipping

charge.description: List of elements that make up a charge

ChargesType.description: Information relating to the charge for the orderLine

purchaseOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the seller's purchase order

customerOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the sales order for specified customer

customerEmailId.description: The email address of the customer for the sales order

orderType.description: Specifies if the order is a regular order or replacement order. Possible values are REGULAR or REPLACEMENT. Provided in response only if query parameter replacementInfo=true.

originalCustomerOrderID.description: customer order ID of the original customer order on which the replacement is created.

orderDate.description: The date the customer submitted the sales order

buyerId.description: Unique ID associated with the specified buyer

productName.description: The name of the product associated with the line item. Example: 'Kenmore CF1' or '2086883 Canister Secondary Filter Generic 2 Pack'

sku.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, assigned to each item in the XSD file.

ItemType.description: The information for the item on the orderLine

currency.description: The type of currency for the charge. Example: USD for US Dollars

amount.description: The numerical amount for that charge. Example: 9.99

MoneyType.description: The details for the amount of the tax charge

cancellationReason.description: If order is cancelled, cancellationReason will explain the reason

OrderLineStatusType.description: Details about the Order Line status

orderLineStatus.description: Details about the Order Line status

OrderLineStatusesType.description: A list of statuses for the Order Line

lineNumber.description: The line number associated with the details for each individual item in the purchase order

statusDate.description: The date shown on the recent order status

OrderLineType.description: Purchase Order line information for each item

orderLine.description: Purchase Order line information for each item

OrderLinesType.description: A list of order lines in the order

address1.description: The first line of the shipping address

address2.description: The second line of the shipping address

city.description: The city of the shipping address

state.description: The state of the shipping address

postalCode.description: The zip code of the shipping address

country.description: The country of the shipping address

PostalAddressType.description: Elements of the customer's postal address

RefundType.description: Details about any refund on the order

type.description: Specifies the type of shipNode. Allowed values are SellerFulfilled, WFSFulfilled and 3PLFulfilled.

estimatedDeliveryDate.description: The estimated time and date for the delivery of the item. Format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:MM:ssZ Example: '2016-06-15T06:00:00Z'

estimatedShipDate.description: The estimated time and date when the item will be shipped. Format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:MM:ssZ Example: '2016-06-15T06:00:00Z'

methodCode.description: The shipping method. Can be one of the following: Standard, Express, Oneday, or Freight

ShippingInfoType.description: The shipping information provided by the customer to the seller

taxName.description: The name associated with the tax. Example: 'Sales Tax'

TaxType.description: Tax information for the charge, including taxName and taxAmount

shipDateTime.description: The date the package was shipped

methodCode.description: The shipping method. Can be one of the following: Standard, Express, Oneday, or Freight

trackingURL.description: The URL for tracking the shipment. This parameter is mandatory if the otherCarrier parameter is used

TrackingInfoType.description: List of information about the package shipment and tracking updates

ShipLineStatusType.description: Details about the Order Line status

orderLineStatus.description: Details about the Order Line status

ShipLineStatusesType.description: A list of status updates for that orderLine, including shipping status updates

ShippingLineType.description: Information about one order line shipment

orderLine.description: Information about one order line shipment

ShippingLinesType.description: List of orderLines in the shipment

CancelLineStatusType.description: List of details about the cancellation status update

orderLineStatus.description: List of details about the cancellation status update

CancelLineStatusesType.description: Information to update the orderLine with cancellation details

CancelLineType.description: A list of orderLines to be cancelled

orderLine.description: A list of orderLines to be cancelled

limit.description: Number of purchase orders in the current page.

nextCursor.description: String to be used as query parameter for getting next set of purchase orders, when more than 200 orders are retrieved.

purchaseOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the seller's purchase order

customerOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the sales order for specified customer

customerEmailId.description: The email address of the customer for the sales order

orderDate.description: The date the customer submitted the sales order

authorization.name: Authorization
authorization.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

accessToken.name: WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN
accessToken.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

channelType.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
channelType.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

correlationId.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID
correlationId.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID

accessTokenScheme.description: Header authentication with a Walmart access token, which is automatically generated using your Client ID and Client Secret. The token is valid for 15 minutes, and will be passed in the WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN header

consumerIdScheme.name: WM_CONSUMER.ID
consumerIdScheme.description: Header authentication with your Walmart consumer ID, which is passed in the WM_CONSUMER.ID header. This is always used in tandem with signature authentication (below). When using endpoints that require consumer ID authentication, you must pass the `consumerId` option to the `Configuration` constructor.

partnerScheme.name: WM_PARTNER.ID
partnerScheme.description: Header authentication with your Walmart partner ID, which is passed in the WM_PARTNER.ID header. Required by Supplier API endpoints. When using endpoints that require partner ID authentication, you must pass the `partnerId` option to the `Configuration` constructor.

signatureScheme.name: WM_SEC.AUTH_SIGNATURE
signatureScheme.description: Request signature authentication. Request signatures are generated using a combination of request info, a timestamp, and your Walmart consumer ID and private key. The signature is passed in the WM_SEC.AUTH_SIGNATURE header. This is always used in tandem with consumer ID authentication (above). When using endpoints that require signature authentication, you must pass the `privateKey` and `consumerId` options to the `Configuration` constructor.
